title: U.N. in Drive for Centralised Global Governance of Artificial Intelligence
description: A U.N. panel on artificial intelligence has been launched to implement global governance of the emerging technology at its sole direction.
content:
A U.N. panel on artificial intelligence has been launched to implement global governance of the emerging technology at its sole direction, the body’s chief António Guterres announced Thursday.

title: Macron is setting up a G7 showdown with Trump over social media
description: The French leader says protecting children from the harms of social media and artificial intelligence will be a priority for his country’s Group of Seven presidency.
content:
French President Emmanuel Macron is preparing for one more big moment on the world stage — and it looks like he wants to mark it with a fight with U.S. President Donald Trump over social media and free speech.

title: AI Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: Leaders to issue joint declaration; Sundar Pichai, Vijay Shekhar Sharma among speakers
description: AI Summit 2026 LIVE: Dozens of world leaders and ministers are expected to deliver on Friday a shared view of how to handle artificial intelligence, wrapping up the five-day summit focussed on AI. This is the last day of the summit itself but the expo will continue for another day.

title: A private credit giant has 70% of its portfolio in software cos, and its investors want their money back
description: New York-based Blue Owl has faced increasing withdrawal requests from investors in recent months, fueled in part by concerns about its exposure to software companies amid the rapid rise of artificial intelligence.
content:

title: Amazon layoffs reportedly hit hundreds of New York employees
description: Amazon layoffs in New York are reportedly part of CEO Andy Jassy's sweeping 16,000-job restructuring effort to reduce layers and remove bureaucracy while investing in artificial intelligence.
content:
Amazon’s latest wave of layoffs has reportedly hit New York, with hundreds of employees losing their jobs.
